title: Propulsion Assignment
description: This assignment focuses on analyzing the principles of propulsion systems in aerospace engineering. You will be tasked with calculating thrust and evaluating different engine types.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: In this assignment, you will perform an in-depth analysis of combustion processes in rocket engines. It includes calculations for efficiency and emissions.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: You are required to design a nozzle for a rocket engine, considering factors such as pressure, temperature, and material strength. The project includes simulations and analysis.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: This quiz tests your understanding of aerodynamic principles, including airflow dynamics, drag, and lift. It is essential to apply your theoretical knowledge in solving practical problems.

title: Flow Analysis
description: Analyze and simulate fluid flow through various structures. You will apply Bernoulli's equation and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) methods to assess flow efficiency.

title: Heating Analysis
description: This assignment focuses on evaluating heat transfer in aerospace components. You will calculate thermal conductivity and conduct heat transfer simulations to design components that can withstand high temperatures.

title: Structural Design Task
description: In this task, you will design a structural component for an aerospace vehicle, taking into account material properties, stress limits, and weight restrictions.

title: Orbital Calculations
description: This assignment involves performing orbital calculations for satellites, including velocity, trajectory, and orbital decay. You will use Kepler's laws and other celestial mechanics principles.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description: The exam covers all major topics of systems engineering, including system design, integration, and testing. You will be asked to solve problems that require a multidisciplinary approach.
